intro: Pleurothallis nellyae, commonly known as the Nelly's orchid, is a species native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It is a small, epiphytic orchid that typically grows on tree branches or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. Its blooms are often short-lived but attract various pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
